Module edu.wgu.qam2schedulingapp
Package edu.wgu.qam2schedulingapp.controller

Class AppointmentEditorController

java.lang.Object
edu.wgu.qam2schedulingapp.controller.AppointmentEditorController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AppointmentEditorController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller for the Appointment Editor view.

This controller manages the operations related to the creation and modification of appointments in the application. It allows for the initialization of the relevant form fields, validation of user entries, and application of changes to the appointment data.

Implements the Initializable interface for setup upon loading the view.

Author:
Parham Modirniya

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the AppointmentEditorController.

      This method is called to initialize the AppointmentEditorController after its root element has been completely processed. It initializes the log, sets the ComboBox items and values, and applies cell factories to certain ComboBoxes.

      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      resourceBundle - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

    • updateUI

      public void updateUI(Appointment appointment)
      Updates the AppointmentEditorController user interface based on the provided Appointment.

      This method is used to populate the UI fields with data from an existing appointment, setting the editor mode to "Modify" or "Add" depending on whether an appointment is provided. If an appointment is provided, its data is used to populate the fields of the editor.

      Parameters:
      appointment - The Appointment object containing the data to populate the UI fields.

    • startDateChosen

      public void startDateChosen()
      Handles the event of a start date being chosen.

      This method validates the chosen start date and end date. If the end date is null or is before the start date, it sets the end date to be the same as the start date. It also disables the start time ComboBox if the start date is null.

    • endDateChosen

      public void endDateChosen()
      Handles the event of an end date being chosen.

      This method disables the end time ComboBox if the end date is null.

    • applyChanges

      public void applyChanges()
      Applies changes to the appointment.

      This method validates the entered appointment details and, if valid, constructs an Appointment object and either adds a new appointment or modifies an existing one in the repository. After applying the changes, it closes the appointment editor.

    • cancel

      public void cancel()
      Closes the appointment editor.

      This method is used to close the AppointmentEditorController window without saving any changes.
